definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
4th note in pentatonic scale 五音[wu3 yin1], roughly sol/see also 徵|征[zheng1]
to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: Using this function, we can get more representational eigenvector from email.
sentences.chinese: 利用此函數可提取到更具有代表性的郵件特徵向量。

sentences.english: Theoretically, the bigger the window, the more similar the feature vector to the real vector;
sentences.chinese: 理論上，窗口越大，特徵向量值越接近真實值。

sentences.english: Three-valued feature vectors based fingerprint matching algorithm is proposed.
sentences.chinese: 提出了基於三值特徵向量的指紋匹配算法。

sentences.english: An expression of the generalized eigenvector of adjoint matrices for nonsingular matrix A is derived.
sentences.chinese: 給出了非奇異矩陣A的伴隨的廣義特徵向量的表達式。

sentences.english: In additon, an important theorem of the eigenvalues and the eigenvectors is demonstrated.
sentences.chinese: 另外，還證明了特徵值及特徵向量的一個重要定理。
